protocol.text: The data were analyzed with Microarray Suite version 5.0 (MAS 5.0) using Affymetrix default analysis settings and global scaling as normalization method. The trimmed mean target intensity of each array was arbitrarily set to 100. ID_REF =  VALUE = MAS5.0-calculated signal intensity ABS_CALL = indicating whether the transcript was present (P), absent (A), or marginal (M) DETECTION P-VALUE = p-value that indicates the significance level of the detection call

Mated L. huidobrensis adults were released on four-week-old Arabidopsis thaliana leaves for oviposition. The adults were removed within 4 h. When the leafminer grew to second instar larvae , the damaged leaves of Arabidopsis thaliana for local damage analysis and the intact leaves on the same plant for systemic damage analysis were separately frozen by liquid nitrogen.

The seeds were surface-sterilized for 15 min in 10% bleach, washed five times with sterile water, and plated on half-strength Murashige and Skoog medium. Plants were stratified at 4 degrees C for 2 days in darkness and then transferred to an environmental chamber set at 22h with a 16-h-light/8-h-dark cycle (light intensity 120 mmol m-2 s-1). After 2 to 3 weeks, seedlings were also potted in a mixed potting medium of peat and vermiculite (1:2), and placed in a growth room at 22 degrees C with a 16-h-light/8-h-dark cycle (light intensity 120 mmol m-2 s-1).
Total RNAs were isolated using the Rneasy(r) Plant Mini Kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA, USA) according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 6 ug total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).
Following fragmentation, 10 ug of cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45C on the GeneChip Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 400.
GeneChips were scanned using the Hewlett-Packard GeneArray Scanner G2500A.
